description: From Late Latin noctivagans, from noctivagare, from Latin nocti- (“night”) + participle form of vagari (“to wander”).

adjectives.description: noctivagant (comparative more noctivagant, superlative most noctivagant)

entries.meaning: Walking or wandering in the nighttime, nightwandering. [from 17th c.]
examples: "'[…] I therefore think, Sarah, that the incommensurability of the crime with the effect, completely warrants the supersaliency of this noctivagant delinquent.'"
